Warning: Couldn't find common resource folders (meshes, textures, sounds, materials, interface, and so on). The mod might fail to load.
Hint: Mixing general, texture, and sound files *might* cause the mod to not load correctly. In case the mod doesn't work, you could try to set it to "Bundled *.ba2 archive".
Hint: For mods with general files, select the general preset or leave it on "Auto-detect".
Hint: For texture replacement mods, select the "Textures (*.dds files)" preset or leave it on "Auto-detect".
Hint: For sound replacement mods, select the "Sound FX / Music / Voice" preset or leave it on "Auto-detect".
Hint: *.dll files are usually installed as "Loose files" into the top directory (".").
Hint: Strings are usually installed as "Loose files" into the "Data" folder.

Messageboxes.Messagebox: Changes have been applied. You may start the game now.

Messageboxes.Messagebox: Please make sure you've installed 'Visual C++ Redistributable for Visual Studio 2012 Update 4'. You can find a link on the NexusMods page.
{0} files are not supported. Please uncompress the archive and add the mod as a folder.

It seems like you've managed mods before, but with a version prior to v1.9.0. How mods are managed and stored has changed significantly. As a result, they must be converted to the new format.
NOTE: This will unfreeze archives. After all mods are converted, they may take up more space, depending on how many mods were frozen. Downgrading will still be possible, but some mods might load incorrectly.
Would you like to convert them now? It won't take long.

Please log in to NexusMods first and try again
You are about to delete '{0}'. Are you sure?
You are about to delete {0} files. Are you sure?

TweakDescriptions.Description: Enables/Disables Steam integration. Disable it to use your Bethesda.net account.
Enabling this, will skip the login prompt if you provide your login credentials.
When this option is enabled, the game will start without displaying the Bethesda logo video.
If enabled, the game won't bother you with news on startup.

After loading into a world or fast traveling, the game plays an animation / fades in from black which also prevents you from moving for a while. This tweak speeds up said animation. Credit goes to u/LinuxVersion from reddit.
⚠️ If the values are set too low or 0, the game will be stuck in a black screen after loading. (Values used by the tweak: fFadeToBlackFadeSeconds=0.2000 and fMinSecondsForLoadFadeIn=0.3000)
If enabled, automatically tracks newly added 'Main' quests.
If enabled, automatically tracks newly added 'Side' quests.
If enabled, automatically tracks newly added 'Miscellaneous' quests.
If enabled, automatically tracks newly added 'Event' quests.
If enabled, automatically tracks newly added 'Daily' quests.
Display resolution

Changes the display mode.
• Fullscreen: Real fullscreen mode (Best Performance) • Windowed: Starts the game in a window with border (aka. window decoration). • Borderless windowed: Allows you to painlessly Alt+Tab, but make sure the resolution matches your display's resolution. (Default) • Borderless windowed (Fullscreen): Same as "Borderless windowed", but window will be maximized to fit your screen. This will look pixelated, if the resolution is lower than your display, as it uses Nearest Neighbor to upscale it.

Disabling this will uncap the frame rate.
• Enable this if you experience screen tearing. • Disable this if you experience input lag.
⚠️ Enabling this might NOT get rid of screen tearing. ⚠️ If you disable this, it is recommended to cap the game to 60 FPS manually. (e.g. using NVIDIA's Control Panel)
ℹ️ Uncapped frame rate shouldn't make the physics go haywire like in older titles, as this has been fixed by Bethesda quite a while ago (in 2018). Capping it to 60 is recommended nonetheless.
Disable this, if you want the game to pause if another window is in front.
Enabling this, will keep the game's window in the foreground. ⚠️ This will prevent you from being able to Alt+Tab on single monitors.

Fixes hidden / borked • lock picking screen and • Power Armor HUD for 5:4 and 4:3 screens.
⚠️ Mostly untested.

Smoothes edges of objects.
• TAA - Temporal Anti-Aliasing: Relatively expensive, can introduce artefacts, default • FXAA - Fast Approximate Anti-Aliasing: Slightly improves performance • Off - Improves performance, degrades visual quality
⚠️ FXAA might not work. The game might just disable AA instead.
Reduces aliasing of textures when viewed from oblique angles.
Disabling this will disable all Depth of Field effects.
Blurs the screen when the player is hurt (e.g. hit by bullets) or under water. ⚠️ Disabling this might result in a clear view underwater.
Enables/disables water displacement (ripples, waves).
Resolution of shadows. Higher settings will make shadows more detailed.
Blurs shadows. Especially useful, if you set a lower shadow resolution.
Sets the distance that shadows are rendered. ⇨ Ultra is 150000 ⇨ High is 120000 ⇨ Medium is 90000 ⇨ Low is 60000
Amount of "segments" of lower-res shadows at a distance. A value of 1 forces the game to render only the lowest resolution shadows.
Distance at which the game will transition to lower-res a shadow "segment". MUST be a multiple of 12.
Sharpens the image. Default: 0.21
Sharpens the image. Default: 0.21 Recommended: 0.4
Enables/disables screen space reflections. Will make water disappear or become pitch black!
Sets the distance grass will begin to fade. ⇨ Ultra is 7000 ⇨ High is 5500 ⇨ Medium is 4500
If disabled, the game will be completely silent.
If unchecked, the game won't play background music in the main menu.
Changes the volume of 'Menu Music'
Changes the volume of 'World Radios'
Changes the volume of 'Voice'
Changes the volume of 'Music'
Changes the volume of 'Effects'
Changes the volume of 'Footsteps'
Changes the volume of 'Pip-Boy Radio'

If enabled, the sensitivity for looking up/down and left/right will be equal. If disabled (default), the sensitivity for looking left/right will likely be higher than up/down.
• Enable this if you're using Mouse & Keyboard. • Disable this if you're using a Gamepad.
⚠️ When enabled, your mouse sensitivity might increase. Decrease your cursor speed or mouse DPI.
ℹ️ The vertical sensitivity depends on your display's aspect ratio: ⇨ For 4:3, the value of Y is 0.028 ⇨ For 16:9, the value of Y is 0.03738 ⇨ For 16:10, the value of Y is 0.0336 ⇨ For 21:9, the value of Y is 0.042 ⇨ For all other aspect ratios, the value of Y is equals to 0.021 times the aspect ratio. (YScale = 0.021 * Width / Height)

If enabled, the sensitivity won't change when aiming. If disabled (default), the sensitivity will be lowered when aiming down sights.
⚠️ This might only work on 16:9 monitors. ⚠️ This might not work in-game while crouching.
ℹ️ This option might not have any effect.
Disable this, if you have a gamepad plugged in, but want to use your keyboard and mouse instead.

When disabled, sets the camera's position into the characters head. You'll need to zoom out in third person. If enabled, sets the camera's position behind the right shoulder.
⚠️ Might cause issues if disabled.

When enabled, the camera will spin around the character after no input was given for a certain amount of time. ⚠️ Not sure if it does anything. I stood around for 5 minutes and the camera didn't spin. Needs more testing.
Changes the field of view of the 3rd person perspective while aiming.
⚠️ Causes issues with the GUI.
By how much the camera gets zoomed out when you look at the ground in 3rd person.
Changes the color of the Pipboy
Changes the color of the Quickboy
Changes the color of the Power Armor Quickboy
When you take screenshots ingame with the print screen button, it saves them in the game directory as "ScreenShotX.png". The "X" being the screenshot index.
This option will make all *.ini files read-only immediately. Enable this if your settings get reverted.
No need to press apply anymore.
Won't check for updates on startup and hides the big update button.
When enabled, the tool will play custom notification sounds.
When enabled, closes the tool when the game is launched. Only works if launched through the tool.
If checked, any *.dll files that don't belong to the game will be renamed.
If checked, mods will be deployed when the Nuclear Winter mode is disabled.
If checked, mods will be removed when the Nuclear Winter mode is enabled.
If checked, it will show the Nuclear Winter / Adventure mode button in the main window, so you can still toggle the deprecated NW mode.
The tool uses Archive2.exe to extract and pack *.ba2 files. You can set the path where the tool looks for Archive2.exe.
The tool uses 7z.exe to extract various archives (zip, rar, 7z). You can set the path where the tool looks for 7z.exe.
When you download mods using the 'Vortex' / 'Mod Manager Download' button on NexusMods, the tool will download the file to this folder.

CheckBox.text: Don't show this again, even after an update.

Label.text: » Now, I know you're a busy fellow, so I won't take up much of your time.\n I just need to verify some information, that's all! «\n – Vault-Tec rep, Oct. 2077
You can skip the game location, if you don't want to install mods.
If you have trouble finding the game location:\n\nSteam: C:\\Program Files (x86)\\Steam\\steamapps\\common\\Fallout76\\\nMicrosoft Store: C:\\Program Files﻿\\ModifiableWindowsApps\\Fallout76\\
Hi, it seems like you started the tool for the first time!\n
Drag-and-drop files/folders into the left box to add/replace files.

CheckBox.Tooltip:
If you 'freeze' an archive, it does not get recreated when deploying. This will speed up deployment.
This is especially useful, if the archive is HUGE (1GiB or more) and the files aren't changing.
Instead of rebuilding bundled archives, it will save a bundled copy and ask you if you want to update it on deploy.

CheckBox.text: Make hard links instead of copying files manually (recommended)
CheckBox.Tooltip: Reduces disk space and deployment time.

Label.text: This tool allows you to change various game settings and install mods.\nTip: Hover over an option, if you're unsure what it does.

CheckBox.text: Speed up fade in after loading
Skip splash screen with news on startup

Label.text:
Your credentials are saved into Fallout76Custom.ini
This way, you don't have to enter your username and password manually
if you start Fallout 76 without the launcher.

If you use Steam and want to use your Bethesda.net account
(e.g. to spent Atoms), untick Enable Steam.
NOTE: Your achievements will be disabled as well!

TrackBar.Tooltip:
Sets the distance grass will begin to fade.
Medium is 4500 High is 5500 Ultra is 7000
Affected values: fGrassStartFadeDistance, fGrassMinStartFadeDistance, fGrassMaxStartFadeDistance Affected files: Fallout76Prefs.ini

Label.text: The preview is only an approximation,\nso it might not look exactly like this in game.
These settings affect both the Pipboy and the Quickboy.
Click 'Refresh gallery' to display screenshots and photos.

CheckBox.Tooltip: Tick this box if you'd like the mod manager to handle the 'Vortex' / 'Mod Manager Download' links (nxm://). You might need to start the tool as admin to enable this option.

CheckBox.text: Show Nuclear Winter toggle button in main window.
Close the tool when the game is launched
Automatically apply changes when tool is closed or game is launched.

Label.text: This translation is out-dated.\nSome elements might not be translated yet.
Fallout 76 cannot be run directly, if installed through the Microsoft Store.
The Bethesda.net launcher has been discontinued on May 11th, 2022.\nThe options are still here for backwards-compatibility. (So nothing breaks)\n
Tip: Right-click on a game profile for more options.

LinkLabel.text: Login doesn't work? Click here to use your API key instead.
How do I login with an API key?
